docs.snippet: Justice Minister Heiko Maas said on Monday the German government could take legal action against Facebook and other social media groups if they do not intensify their fight against illegal hate speech or Islamist "terror phantasies".

headline.print_headline: German Minister Sets March Deadline for Fight Against Online Hate
headline.main: German Minister Sets March Deadline for Fight Against Online Hate

docs.snippet: A federal grand jury has indicted a man who authorities say used a Facebook post to threaten an attack on the LGBT community in South Florida.

headline.print_headline: Grand Jury Indicts Florida Man Over Online LGBT Threats
headline.main: Grand Jury Indicts Florida Man Over Online LGBT Threats

docs.snippet: The office of Kazakhstan's president says he won't participate in Thursday's meeting of the Russian-led Collective Security Treaty Organization in the Armenian capital, Yerevan.

headline.print_headline: Kazakhstan President Cancels Foreign Trip on Health Concerns
headline.main: Kazakhstan President Cancels Foreign Trip on Health Concerns

docs.snippet: App Store Official Charts for the week ending August 21, 2016:

headline.print_headline: The Top iPhone and iPad Apps on App Store
headline.main: The Top iPhone and iPad Apps on App Store

docs.snippet: The stage version of the 2004 movie will feature Tina Fey, Lorne Michaels and Jeff Richmond among the creative team.

headline.print_headline: A ‘Mean Girls’ Musical to Have Fall Premiere
headline.main: ‘That Is So Fetch’: A ‘Mean Girls’ Musical Aims for Fall Run

docs.snippet: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.
docs.abstract: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.

docs.snippet: A Japanese theme park tried to draw visitors by freezing 5,000 fish beneath its ice rink, but a public outcry forced it to close the attraction after just two weeks.

headline.print_headline: Aquarium on Ice Is Closed in Japan After Public Outcry
headline.main: Aquarium on Ice, a Lure for Skaters in Japan, Appalls Them Instead

docs.abstract: Space World amusement park on Japanese island of Kyushu apologizes for freezing around 5,000 fish and other sea creatures below surface of its ice rink; will close attraction until further notice.

docs.snippet: Gab, a social media network built like a hybrid of Twitter and Reddit, bans very little and has become a conservative bunker of sorts.

headline.print_headline: The Far Right Has Found a Digital Oasis
headline.main: The Far Right Has a New Digital Safe Space

docs.abstract: Amanda Hess Critic's Notebook observes rising popularity of invitation-only social network Gab among conservatives; notes site's lax rules have attracted many controversial figures, including white nationalist leader Richard B Spencer, who have been banned by platforms like Twitter, Facebook and Reddit for hate speech and cyber harassment.

docs.snippet: The social network for professionals was found to have violated a law requiring it to store local users’ data within the country.

headline.main: Russia Prepares to Block LinkedIn After Court Ruling

docs.snippet: Ivanovic, who won the French Open in 2008, had slipped down the rankings while dealing with injuries. She said she could no longer play to her standards.

headline.print_headline: Tennis; Former No. 1 Ana Ivanovic Retires at Age 29
headline.main: Ana Ivanovic Retires From Tennis at 29

docs.abstract: Former top-ranked women's tennis player Ana Ivanovic of Serbia announces her retirement, citing injuries that have not allowed her to perform up to her own standards.
